CatDescriptText: Glenn Williams, student, 547 Rosedale Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "Of course, but if the Negroes do not have the money he shouldn't locate there. In fact, I think that the property is at such a high value that even if the Negro wanted to get a place there the price is so jacked up that he would not be able to do so."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Glenn Williams wearing light colored double breasted trench coat with collar, eyeglasses, and cap, standing in front of stone block wall and store window with neon sign
